pros: It builds your resume if you have not had any employment experience before
cons: Pat is low, but it is to expect since is a work-study

pros: Teaching a class is fun and rewarding
cons: Not a lot of administrative support or attention

pros: Fellow professors are motivated and hardworking at their disciplines. They truly want to see the students to be successful.
cons: It is a totally liberal environment, conservatives have learned to keep their mouths shut because they are in a small minority.

pros: Excellent department chair, great students, and supportive faculty. A real gem!
cons: None that I know of or have experienced.

pros: Great work environment and job
cons: None. Other than dealing with college kids

pros: They leave you alone to teach
cons: There isn’t much job security here

job_title: Administrative Assistant in East Norwalk, CT
pros: Taught English to very enthusiastic adults who came to the U. S. from many different countries.
cons: COVID-19 required us to finish the semester virtually.

job_title: Human Resources Generalist in East Hartford, CT
pros: Health insurance, retirement, 401k, and generous time off
cons: Not a place to advance career. Individuals promoted based on friendship versus knowledge. No raises for managers. Nepotism, racism, and sexism. Managers do not lead.

review_title: A good community college with more stringent demands of its students than the four-year schools in the area.
pros: You get a lot of support from the chair of your department. Most students actually want to learn, which is always great. I had a great time teaching there. The pay is competitive for what's in the area. Although you don't get faculty parking, there are usually a few spaces open.
cons: Well, if you're living the life of an itinerant, i.e., adjunct, you class(es) could get cancelled the night before the semester begins. But you can charge that to the game.

review_title: Student body is wonderful,  physical plant is getting better, much of admin support staff is incompetent or rude.
pros:
School has a good reputation
my immediate boss is very supportive
pay is decent
cons:
Nearly impossible to get a full-time position and benefits
Copy equipment is often not working and faculty support office is unstaffed
some of the classrooms are in need of updating
parking can be tricky at peak times
admin staff can be very unhelpful and/or nonresponsive

pros: The many of students are eager to learn and interesting to talk to in and out of classes.  A large portion are new immigrants and are so happy to be getting a college education, they work really hard.
cons: On the other hand, some of our "American born" students are not working up to their potential and lack the drive they need to get ahead.  This is really discouraging to the faculty.

job_title: Director of Financial Aid in Norwalk, CT
pros:
Strong Financial Aid Team.
Wonderful and caring individuals.
Providing opportunities for longevity.
Ample financial aid opportunities for NCC students from federal, state institutional and Title V
cons:
Current state of deficits in the state of CT.
Unavoidable reductions throughout the state universities and community colleges.

review_title: Friendly atmosphere. Great part-time job while finishing a degree.
pros: Flexible with scheduling around classes. Reinforces material having to tutor other students.
cons: Low pay. Not enough to support yourself alone.

pros: It is a good place. It has nice people to work with and good experience.
cons: You have to move a lot from class to class to fix and replace computers and some things else.

pros: Benefits and health care plan
cons: Not much room for growth

review_title: Students make the hard work worth it
job_title: Adjunct Instructor of ESL in Norwalk, CT
pros: Well-developed curriculum, motivated and diverse students, union support
cons: no benefits other than retirement, very few opportunities to get hired full-time

pros: A great opportunity for teachers.
cons: First month of pay is delayed, but other than that they're very professional.

job_title: Adjunct Communications PROFESSOR in Norwalk, CT
pros: Great students and good facilities
cons: At NCC there are really no cons to put in this review

pros: You can have flexible hours
cons: You get paid every two weeks, and the pay is not good

job_title: Adjunct Math Instructor in Norwalk, CT
pros: It was a good experience
